meleeWeapons.name: Clan Dagger
meleeWeapons.text: This broad dagger is carried by dwarves as a weapon, tool, and designation of clan. Losing or having to surrender a clan dagger is considered a mark of embarrassment to most dwarves.

meleeWeapons.name: Club
meleeWeapons.text: This is a piece of stout wood shaped or repurposed to bludgeon an enemy. Clubs can be intricately carved pieces of martial art or as simple as a tree branch or piece of wood.

meleeWeapons.name: Dagger
meleeWeapons.text: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

meleeWeapons.name: Gauntlet
meleeWeapons.text: A pair of these metal gloves comes with full plate, half plate, and splint armor; they can also be purchased separately and worn with other types of armor. They not only protect your hands but also transform your hands into lethal weapons.

meleeWeapons.name: Katar
meleeWeapons.text: Also known as punching daggers, katars are characterized by their H-shaped hand grip that allows the blade to jut out from the knuckles.

meleeWeapons.name: Light Mace
meleeWeapons.text: A light mace has a short wooden or metal shaft ending with a dense metal head. Used much like a club, it delivers heavy bludgeoning blows, but with extra power derived from the head’s metal ridges or spikes.

meleeWeapons.name: Longspear
meleeWeapons.text: This very long spear, sometimes called a pike, is purely for thrusting rather than throwing. Used by many soldiers and city watch for crowd control and defense against charging enemies, it must be wielded with two hands.

meleeWeapons.name: Mace
meleeWeapons.text: With a stout haft and a heavy metal head, a mace is sturdy and allows its wielder to deliver powerful blows and dent armor.

meleeWeapons.name: Morningstar
meleeWeapons.text: This weapon has a short shaft ending in a metal ball studded with spikes.

meleeWeapons.name: Sickle
meleeWeapons.text: Originally a farming tool used for reaping grain, this one-handed weapon has a short wooden handle ending in a curved blade, sometimes sharpened on both sides.

meleeWeapons.name: Spear
meleeWeapons.text: A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.

meleeWeapons.name: Spiked Gauntlet
meleeWeapons.text: Providing the same defensive function as a standard gauntlet, this version has a group of spikes protruding from the knuckles to deliver piercing damage with a punch.

meleeWeapons.name: Staff
meleeWeapons.text: This long piece of wood can aid in walking and deliver a mighty blow.

meleeWeapons.name: Bastard Sword
meleeWeapons.text: This broad-bladed sword, sometimes called the hand‑and‑a‑half sword, has a longer grip so it can be held in one hand or used with two hands to provide extra piercing or slashing power.

meleeWeapons.name: Battle Axe
meleeWeapons.text: These axes are designed explicitly as weapons, rather than tools. They typically weigh less, with a shaft reinforced with metal bands or bolts, and have a sharper blade, making them ideal for chopping limbs rather than wood.

meleeWeapons.name: Bo Staff
meleeWeapons.text: This strong but slender staff is tapered at the ends and well balanced. It’s designed to be an offensive and defensive weapon.

meleeWeapons.name: Dogslicer
meleeWeapons.text: This short, curved, and crude makeshift blade often has holes drilled into it to reduce its weight. It’s a favored weapon of goblins.

meleeWeapons.name: Elven Curve Blade
meleeWeapons.text: Essentially a longer version of the scimitar, this traditional elven weapon has a thinner blade than its cousin.

meleeWeapons.name: Falchion
meleeWeapons.text: This weapon is a heavier, two-handed version of the curved-bladed scimitar. It is weighted toward the blade’s end, making it a powerful slashing weapon.

meleeWeapons.name: Fauchard
meleeWeapons.text: A fauchard is similar to a glaive, save that its cutting edge is along the concave side. Fauchards are favored by Crimson Reclaimers for hacking through waves of zombies. The fauchard is a martial melee weapon.

meleeWeapons.name: Filcher's Fork
meleeWeapons.text: This halfling weapon looks like a long, two-pronged fork and is used as both a weapon and a cooking implement.

meleeWeapons.name: Flail
meleeWeapons.text: This weapon consists of a wooden handle attached to a spiked ball or cylinder by a chain, rope, or strap of leather.

meleeWeapons.name: Glaive
meleeWeapons.text: This polearm consists of a long, single-edged blade on the end of a 7-foot pole. It is extremely effective at delivering lethal cuts at a distance.

meleeWeapons.name: Gnome Hooked Hammer
meleeWeapons.text: This gnome tool and weapon features a hammer at one end and a curved pick on the other. It’s such a strange and awkward weapon that others think the gnomes are slightly erratic for using it.

meleeWeapons.name: Greataxe
meleeWeapons.text: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often “bearded,” having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.

meleeWeapons.name: Greatclub
meleeWeapons.text: While many greatclubs are intricately carved, others are little more than a sturdy tree branch. These massive clubs are too heavy to wield with only one hand.

meleeWeapons.name: Greatpick
meleeWeapons.text: This pick has a longer handle and broader head than a regular pick. It is too heavy to wield in one hand.

meleeWeapons.name: Greatsword
meleeWeapons.text: This immense two-handed sword is nearly as tall as its wielder. Its lower blade is often somewhat dulled to allow it to be gripped for extra leverage in close-quarter fights.

meleeWeapons.name: Guisarme
meleeWeapons.text: This polearm bears a long, often one‑sided, curved blade with a hook protruding from the blunt side of the blade, which can allow its wielder to trip opponents at a distance. Its shaft is usually 8 feet long.

meleeWeapons.name: Halberd
meleeWeapons.text: This polearm has a relatively short, 5-foot shaft. The business end is a long spike with an axe blade attached.

meleeWeapons.name: Hatchet
meleeWeapons.text: This small axe can be used in close combat or thrown.

meleeWeapons.name: Horsechopper
meleeWeapons.text: Created by goblins to battle horses, this weapon is essentially a long shaft ending in a blade with a large hook.

meleeWeapons.name: Kama
meleeWeapons.text: Similar to a sickle and used in some regions to reap grain, a kama has a short, slightly curved blade and a wooden handle.

meleeWeapons.name: Katana
meleeWeapons.text: A katana is a curved, single-edged sword known for its wickedly sharped blade.

meleeWeapons.name: Kukri
meleeWeapons.text: The blade of this foot-long knife curves inward and lacks a cross guard at the hilt.

meleeWeapons.name: Lance
meleeWeapons.text: This spear-like weapon is used by a mounted creature to deal a great deal of damage.

meleeWeapons.name: Light Hammer
meleeWeapons.text: This smaller version of the warhammer has a wooden or metal shaft ending in a metal head. Unlike its heavier cousin, it is light enough to throw.

meleeWeapons.name: Light Pick
meleeWeapons.text: A light pick is a modified mining implement with a wooden shaft ending in a pick head crafted more to pierce armor and flesh than chip rocks.

meleeWeapons.name: Longsword
meleeWeapons.text: Longswords can be one-edged or two‑edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they’re between 3 and 4 feet in length.

meleeWeapons.name: Main-gauche
meleeWeapons.text: This parrying dagger features a robust guard to protect the wielder’s hand.

meleeWeapons.name: Maul
meleeWeapons.text: Mauls are massive warhammers that must be swung with two hands.

meleeWeapons.name: Nunchaku
meleeWeapons.text: The nunchaku is constructed of two wooden or metal bars connected by a short length of rope or chain.

meleeWeapons.name: Orc Knuckle Dagger
meleeWeapons.text: This stout, metal blade of orc design has a horizontal basket hilt with blades jutting from each end, or sometimes one blade like that of a katar.

meleeWeapons.name: Pick
meleeWeapons.text: A pick designed solely for combat has a sturdy wooden shaft and a heavy, pointed head to deliver devastating blows.

meleeWeapons.name: Ranseur
meleeWeapons.text: This polearm is a long trident with a central prong that’s longer than the other two.

meleeWeapons.name: Rapier
meleeWeapons.text: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.

meleeWeapons.name: Sai
meleeWeapons.text: This piercing dagger is a metal spike flanked by a pair of prongs that can be used to trap an enemy’s weapon.

meleeWeapons.name: Sap
meleeWeapons.text: A sap has a soft wrapping around a dense core, typically a leather sheath around a lead rod. Its head is wider than its grip to disperse the force of a blow, as the weapon’s purpose is to knock out its victim rather than to draw blood.

meleeWeapons.name: Scimitar
meleeWeapons.text: This one-handed curved blade is sharp on one side.

meleeWeapons.name: Scourge
meleeWeapons.text: A scourge—also known as a cat-o’-nine-tails—is a set of several knotted cords made from cotton or leather and attached to a handle. While most scourges are more suitable for torture than combat, the weapons used by the Order of the Scourge have metal barbs woven in to pierce clothing and armor. The scourge is a martial melee weapon.

meleeWeapons.name: Scythe
meleeWeapons.text: Derived from a farming tool used to mow down long grains and cereals, this weapon has a long wooden shaft with protruding handles, capped with a curved blade set at a right angle.

meleeWeapons.name: Shield Bash
meleeWeapons.text: A shield bash is not actually a weapon, but a maneuver in which you thrust or swing your shield to hit your foe with an impromptu attack.

meleeWeapons.name: Shield Boss
meleeWeapons.text: Typically a round, convex, or conical piece of thick metal attached to the center of a shield, a shield boss increases the bludgeoning damage of a shield bash.

meleeWeapons.name: Shield Spikes
meleeWeapons.text: These metal spikes are strategically placed on the defensive side of the shield to deal piercing damage with a shield bash.

meleeWeapons.name: Shortsword
meleeWeapons.text: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

meleeWeapons.name: Spiked Chain
meleeWeapons.text: This 4‑foot‑long length of chain is covered with barbs and has spikes on one or both ends. Some feature metal hoops used as handgrips.

meleeWeapons.name: Starknife
meleeWeapons.text: From a central metal ring, four tapering metal blades extend like points on a compass rose. When gripping a starknife from the center, the wielder can use it as a melee weapon. It can also be thrown short distances.

meleeWeapons.name: Temple Sword
meleeWeapons.text: This heavy blade is favored by guardians of religious sites. It has a distinctive, crescent-shaped blade that seems to be a mix of a sickle and sword. It often has holes drilled into the blade or the pommel so that bells or other holy trinkets can be affixed to the weapon as an aid for prayer or mediation.

meleeWeapons.name: Trident
meleeWeapons.text: This three-pronged, spear-like weapon typically has a 4-foot shaft. Like a spear, it can be wielded with one hand or thrown.

meleeWeapons.name: War Flail
meleeWeapons.text: This large flail has a long shaft connected to a shorter piece of stout wood or metal that’s sometimes inlaid with spikes.

meleeWeapons.name: Warhammer
meleeWeapons.text: This weapon has a wooden shaft ending in a large, heavy metal head. The head of the hammer might be single-sided or double-sided, but it’s always capable of delivering powerful bludgeoning blows.

meleeWeapons.name: Whip
meleeWeapons.text: This long strand of thick leather, often braided, delivers a painful but nonlethal slash at a distance, usually accompanied by a distinctive cracking sound.

meleeWeapons.name: Aklys
meleeWeapons.text: The aklys is a throwing club with a hook on one end and a lengthy cord attached to the other. Though aklyses aren’t available in most shops, one might be purchased for 5 gp from a vendor that specializes in strange weapons.

meleeWeapons.name: Aldori Dueling Sword
meleeWeapons.text:
An Aldori dueling sword is a slim, single-bladed dueling sword with a slight curve and
a sharp, reinforced point.

meleeWeapons.name: Dwarven War Axe
meleeWeapons.text: This favored weapon of the dwarves has a large, ornate head mounted on a thick handle. This powerful axe can be wielded with one hand or two.

meleeWeapons.name: Gnome Flickmace
meleeWeapons.text: More a flail than a mace, this weapon has a short handle attached to a length of chain with a ball at the end. The ball is propelled to its reach with the flick of the wrist, the momentum of which brings the ball back to the wielder after the strike.

meleeWeapons.name: Ogre Hook
meleeWeapons.text: Ogres are known for using immense, curved picks called ogre hooks.

meleeWeapons.name: Orc Necksplitter
meleeWeapons.text: This single-bladed bearded axe has a jagged blade that’s perfect for separating bone from tendon and cartilage.

meleeWeapons.name: Sawtooth Saber
meleeWeapons.text: The signature weapon of the Red Mantis assassins, this curved blade is serrated like a saw, hence the name.

rangeWeapons.name: Blowgun
rangeWeapons.text: This long, narrow tube is used for shooting blowgun darts, using only the power of a forcefully exhaled breath.

rangeWeapons.name: Crossbow
rangeWeapons.text: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

rangeWeapons.name: Dart
rangeWeapons.text: This thrown weapon is larger than an arrow but shorter than a javelin. It typically has a short shaft of wood ending in a metal tip and is sometimes stabilized by feathers or fur.

rangeWeapons.name: Hand Crossbow
rangeWeapons.text: Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It’s small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.

rangeWeapons.name: Heavy Crossbow
rangeWeapons.text: This large crossbow is harder to load and more substantial than a regular crossbow, but it packs a greater punch.

rangeWeapons.name: Javelin
rangeWeapons.text: This thin spear is well balanced for throwing but is not designed for melee use.

rangeWeapons.name: Sling
rangeWeapons.text: Little more than a leather cup attached to a pair of straps, a sling can be used to fling smooth stones or sling bullets at a range.

rangeWeapons.name: Alchemical Bomb
rangeWeapons.text: These bombs come in a variety of types and levels of power, but no matter the variety, you throw the bomb at the target and it explodes, unleashing its alchemical blast.

rangeWeapons.name: Composite Longbow
rangeWeapons.text: This projectile weapon is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Like all longbows, its great size also increases the bow’s range and power. You must use two hands to fire it, and it cannot be used while mounted. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a longbow, such as Erastil’s favored weapon, it also applies to composite longbows unless otherwise stated.

rangeWeapons.name: Composite Shortbow
rangeWeapons.text: This shortbow is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Its compact size and power make it a favorite of mounted archers. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a shortbow, it also applies to composite shortbows unless otherwise stated.

rangeWeapons.name: Halfling Sling Staff
rangeWeapons.text: This staff ends in a Y-shaped split that cradles a sling. The length of the staff provides excellent leverage when used two‑handed to fling rocks or bullets from the sling.

rangeWeapons.name: Longbow
rangeWeapons.text: This 5-foot-tall bow, usually made of a single piece of elm, hickory, or yew, has a powerful draw and is excellent at propelling arrows with great force and at an extreme distance. You must use two hands to fire a longbow, and it can’t be used while mounted.

rangeWeapons.name: Shortbow
rangeWeapons.text: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

rangeWeapons.name: Shuriken
rangeWeapons.text: This “throwing star” is a small piece of flat metal with sharp edges, designed to be flung with a flick of the wrist.

rangeWeapons.name: Arrows
rangeWeapons.text: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

rangeWeapons.name: Blowgun Darts
rangeWeapons.text: These thin, light darts are typically made of hardwood and stabilized with fletching of down or fur. They are often hollow so they can be used to deliver poison.

rangeWeapons.name: Bolts
rangeWeapons.text: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

rangeWeapons.name: Sling Bullets
rangeWeapons.text: These are small metal balls, typically either iron or lead, designed to be used as ammunition in slings.

baseMagicWeapons.name: Magic Weapon (+1)
baseMagicWeapons.text: A magic weapon is a weapon etched with only fundamental runes. A weapon potency rune gives an item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon, and a striking rune increases the weapon’s number of weapon damage dice. The Prices here are for all types of weapons. You don’t need to adjust the Price from a club to a greataxe or the like. These weapons are made of standard materials, not precious materials such as cold iron. This weapon has a rune (+1 item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon).

baseMagicWeapons.name: Magic Weapon (+1 Striking)
baseMagicWeapons.text: A magic weapon is a weapon etched with only fundamental runes. A weapon potency rune gives an item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon, and a striking rune increases the weapon’s number of weapon damage dice. The Prices here are for all types of weapons. You don’t need to adjust the Price from a club to a greataxe or the like. These weapons are made of standard materials, not precious materials such as cold iron. This weapon has a rune (+1 item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon) and a rune (one extra damage die).

You don’t need to adjust the Price from a club to a greataxe or the like. These weapons are made of standard materials, not precious materials such as cold iron. This weapon has a rune (+2 item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon) and a striking rune (one additional damage die).

baseMagicWeapons.text: A magic weapon is a weapon etched with only fundamental runes. A weapon potency rune gives an item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon, and a striking rune increases the weapon’s number of weapon damage dice. The Prices here are for all types of weapons. You don’t need to adjust the Price from a club to a greataxe or the like. These weapons are made of standard materials, not precious materials such as cold iron. This weapon has a rune (+2 item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon) and a rune (two extra damage dice).

A weapon potency rune gives an item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon, and a striking rune increases the weapon’s number of weapon damage dice. The Prices here are for all types of weapons. You don’t need to adjust the Price from a club to a greataxe or the like. These weapons are made of standard materials, not precious materials such as cold iron. This weapon has a rune (+3 item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon) and a rune (two extra damage dice).

baseMagicWeapons.text: A magic weapon is a weapon etched with only fundamental runes. A weapon potency rune gives an item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon, and a striking rune increases the weapon’s number of weapon damage dice. The Prices here are for all types of weapons. You don’t need to adjust the Price from a club to a greataxe or the like. These weapons are made of standard materials, not precious materials such as cold iron. This weapon has a rune (+3 item bonus to attack rolls with the weapon) and a rune (three extra damage dice).

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Cold Iron Weapon (Low-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.craftrequirements: at least 20 sp of cold iron + 2 sp per Bulk
specialMaterialWeapons.text: Cold iron weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to cold iron, like demons and fey.

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Cold Iron Weapon (Standard-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.craftrequirements: at least 110 gp of cold iron + 11 gp per Bulk
specialMaterialWeapons.text: Cold iron weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to cold iron, like demons and fey.

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Cold Iron Weapon (High-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.craftrequirements: at least 4,500 gp of cold iron + 450 gp per Bulk
specialMaterialWeapons.text: Cold iron weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to cold iron, like demons and fey.

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Silver Weapon (Low-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.craftrequirements: at least 20 sp of silver + 2 sp per Bulk
specialMaterialWeapons.text: Silver weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to silver, like werewolves, and ignore the resistances of some other creatures, like devils.

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Silver Weapon (Standard-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.craftrequirements: at least 110 gp of silver + 11 gp per Bulk
specialMaterialWeapons.text: Silver weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to silver, like werewolves, and ignore the resistances of some other creatures, like devils.

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Silver Weapon (High-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.craftrequirements: at least 4,500 gp of silver + 450 gp per Bulk
specialMaterialWeapons.text: Silver weapons deal additional damage to creatures with weakness to silver, like werewolves, and ignore the resistances of some other creatures, like devils.

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Adamantine Weapon (Standard-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.craftrequirements: at least 175 gp of adamantine + 17.5 gp per Bulk
specialMaterialWeapons.text: Adamantine weapons have a shiny black appearance and cut through lesser items with ease. They treat any object they hit as if it had half as much Hardness as usual, unless the object’s Hardness is greater than that of the adamantine weapon.

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Adamantine Weapon (High-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.craftrequirements: at least 6,750 gp of adamantine + 675 gp per Bulk
specialMaterialWeapons.text: Adamantine weapons have a shiny black appearance and cut through lesser items with ease. They treat any object they hit as if it had half as much Hardness as usual, unless the object’s Hardness is greater than that of the adamantine weapon.

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Darkwood Weapon (Standard-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.craftrequirements: at least 175 gp of darkwood + 17.5 gp per Bulk
specialMaterialWeapons.text: Darkwood weapons are as dark as ebony, with a slight purple tint. A darkwood weapon’s Bulk is reduced by 1 (or to light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a weapon that normally has light Bulk).

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Darkwood Weapon (High-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.craftrequirements: at least 6,750 gp of darkwood + 675 gp per Bulk
specialMaterialWeapons.text: Darkwood weapons are as dark as ebony, with a slight purple tint. A darkwood weapon’s Bulk is reduced by 1 (or to light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a weapon that normally has light Bulk).

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Mithral Weapon (Standard-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.craftrequirements: at least 175 gp of mithral + 17.5 gp per Bulk
specialMaterialWeapons.text: Mithral weapons are slightly lighter than silver. A mithral weapon is 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a weapon that normally has light Bulk).

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Mithral Weapon (High-Grade)
specialMaterialWeapons.craftrequirements: at least 6,750 gp of mithral + 675 gp per Bulk
specialMaterialWeapons.text: Mithral weapons are slightly lighter than silver. A mithral weapon is 1 Bulk lighter than normal (or light Bulk if its normal Bulk is 1, with no effect on a weapon that normally has light Bulk).

specialMaterialWeapons.name: Orichalcum Weapon
specialMaterialWeapons.text: Orichalcum weapons can have four magic property runes instead of three. Due to orichalcum’s temporal properties, etching the weapon property rune onto an orichalcum weapon costs half the normal Price (though transferring the rune to a weapon made of another material requires you to first pay the remaining Price and then pay the cost to transfer).
specialMaterialWeapons.craft requirements: at least 11,250 gp of orichalcum + 1,125 gp per Bulk

magicWeapons.name: Scrollstaff
magicWeapons.text: A band of pliant wood encircles the head of this slender mahogany staff. The Magaambya created the first scrollstaves millennia ago, and even the few scrollstaves found beyond the organization often incorporate Magaambyan iconography as an homage to their source. A scrollstaff serves as a weapon just like an ordinary staff and can be improved via runes like any other staff. In addition, if you are capable of creating magical scrolls, you can inscribe a single scroll onto the staff’s head for the same cost as normal for Crafting the scroll. If necessary, you can embed a required material focus into the staff as part of the same Craft activity. As long as you are holding the staff, you can cast the spell from the staff’s head. Casting the written spell works just like casting from a scroll, but you can perform the necessary material component with the staff, even if you don’t have a free hand. Once you cast the inscribed spell, any material focus remains embedded in the staff until removed as an Interact action. The staff can hold only a single scroll at a time. If you inscribe a new scroll before casting the previous spell, you replace the existing spell and remove any previous material focus as part of the Craft activity to write the new scroll.

magicWeapons.name: Fighter's Fork
magicWeapons.text: This +1 trident , usually engraved with a decorative pattern resembling fish scales, is a common weapon among warriors of aquatic ancestries.
magicWeapons.effect: You extend or shorten the trident’s haft. When extended, the trident requires two hands to wield and gains the reach trait, but loses the trident’s normal thrown trait.

magicWeapons.name: Retribution Axe
magicWeapons.text: The blade of this +1 greataxe bears a design of a human skull. Whenever a creature damages you with an attack, the skull changes its appearance to look like the face of that creature. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your next damage roll against that creature before the end of your next turn. Because the face reshapes each time you’re damaged, you get the additional damage only if you attack the creature that damaged you most recently.

magicWeapons.name: Dagger of Venom
magicWeapons.text: The serrated blade of this +1 striking dagger has a greenish tinge, and the hilt is sculpted to look like the head of a serpent about to strike. When you critically succeed at an attack roll with the dagger of venom , the target becomes sickened 1 unless it succeeds at a DC 19 Fortitude save. This is a poison effect. In addition, you can activate the dagger to poison a creature with a more potent poison. dagger of venom
magicWeapons.trigger: You damage a creature with the dagger of venom ;
magicWeapons.effect: You poison the creature you hit with dagger venom.

magicWeapons.name: Caterwaul Sling
magicWeapons.text: Made of shiny brown leather, this +1 striking sling has a single white thread interwoven into its cord.
magicWeapons.effect: You pull the white thread free, then whirl the sling in circles at high speed. It lets out an ear-piercing wave of sound. Each creature in a 30-foot cone takes 4d6 sonic damage (DC 21 basic Fortitude save). Any creature that fails is deafened for 1 round, or 1 hour on a critical failure.

magicWeapons.name: Bloodletting Kukri
magicWeapons.text: This +1 striking kukri has a crimson blade that shimmers eerily in bright light. On a critical hit, the kukri deals 1d8 persistent bleed damage. If the target didn’t already have persistent bleed damage when you scored the critical hit, you also gain 1d8 temporary Hit Points.

magicWeapons.name: Twining Staff
magicWeapons.text: Appearing to be just a small, flat disc made of twigs, this item can grow and shrink. +1 striking staff +1 striking bo staff
magicWeapons.effect: You cause the twigs to rapidly grow or contract, reshaping into a +1 striking staff , a +1 striking bo staff , or its disc form. In its disc form, it has negligible Bulk and must be held in one hand to be activated. In the other forms, it has the same Bulk as a normal weapon of its type. You can switch your grip as part of the activation. When you expand the item, you can use the force of the expansion to High Jump or to try to Force Open a door or the like by wedging the disc into a gap before activation. The staff makes the Athletics check with a +15 modifier.

magicWeapons.name: Eclipse
magicWeapons.text: This +1 returning striking cold iron starknife has an ornate central grip that depicts a silver dragon, the neck, wings, and tail of which wrap over and around the handle in knots to support the weapon’s four cold iron blades. While the handle is polished to a mirrorlike shine, the blades of Eclipse are a flat black and entirely unreflective. Eclipse is also the portal key required to activate Dreamgate at Alseta’s Ring. Whenever you score a critical hit with Eclipse , the target creature’s eyes are plunged into darkness; if that creature doesn’t have darkvision, it is blinded for 1 round.
magicWeapons.frequency: once per day; three times per day;
magicWeapons.effect: Eclipse’s blades glow like starlit night sky, causing it to shed light as a torch until you deactivate it as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. You absorb light, gaining a +2 status bonus to the Stealth check.

magicWeapons.name: Crimson Brand
magicWeapons.text: These ominous swords are decorated with crimson lacquer and serve as perfect conduits for the Crimson Oath’s power. The first was granted to Clarethe Iomedar by a mysterious patron who many Reclaimers believe to be an emissary of Ragathiel. A crimson brand is a +1 striking wounding bastard sword . When the wielder uses the crimson brand to cast , they can generate a 60-foot line or a 30-foot cone instead of the normal 20-foot cone. Whenever the wielder would inflict on an undead creature with the crimson brand , they can instead wreathe the creature in ruby energy, inflicting the same amount of persistent positive damage instead of persistent bleed damage.

magicWeapons.name: Gloom Blade
magicWeapons.text: As black as coal, this blade grows more potent in darkness. While in bright light, it functions as a +1 shortsword and doesn’t appear to radiate a magic aura to detect magic or similar spells unless the spells are 4th level or higher. In dim light or darkness, the gloom blade becomes a +2 striking shortsword . Whenever you use the gloom blade to attack a creature you’re undetected by, you deal 1d6 additional precision damage. To upgrade the gloom blade’s fundamental runes, start with the base +1 shortsword , but if you improve it beyond a +2 striking shortsword , the runes apply in dim light or darkness as well.

magicWeapons.name: Oathbow
magicWeapons.text: Constructed of a flexible, white wood and with ornate, twisting designs carved into its surface, this +2 striking composite longbow appears to have been made by elves. Sometimes when you loose an arrow, its whistling in flight sounds like a voice whispering in Elven, wishing for the swift defeat of your enemies.
magicWeapons.effect: You swear an oath to destroy one creature you can see. For the next 7 days or until that creature is slain, your attacks with the bow against that creature deal 1d6 additional damage, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Survival checks to Track that creature. Your critical hits against the target gain the bow’s critical specialization effect; if they would already do so, they instead increase the DC of the Athletics check to Escape when critically hit to DC 20. After you activate the bow, you can’t activate it again for 7 days. If you kill the creature you’ve sworn an oath against, the oath ends and you need to wait only 10 minutes before you can activate it again.

magicWeapons.name: Dwarven Thrower
magicWeapons.text: This +2 striking warhammer is inlaid with precious metals and decorated with geometric patterns in a dwarven style. If you’re a dwarf, a dwarven thrower functions for you as a +2 greater striking returning warhammer with the thrown 30 feet trait, and your attacks with the hammer deal 1d8 additional damage against giants.

magicWeapons.name: Flame Tongue
magicWeapons.text: This +2 greater striking flaming longsword has an ornate brass hilt and a blade shaped like stylized flames. When wielded, the blade projects illumination resembling shimmering firelight, emitting dim light in a 10-foot radius. cantrip from the sword as a 7th-level arcane spell, using your melee attack modifier with flametongue as your spell attack modifier.

magicWeapons.name: Holy Avenger
magicWeapons.text: The gleaming holy avenger is the iconic weapon of powerful . The crossbar of this +2 greater striking holy cold iron longsword is styled to look like angel wings. Tradition holds that those who see their reflection in a holy avenger’s highly polished blade have their faults laid bare. If you are evil, you are enfeebled 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon. holy avenger detect alignment dispel magic
magicWeapons.frequency: once per hour; once per day;
magicWeapons.effect: You command the sword and point it at a creature you can see. The sword casts detect alignment to detect evil, but this targets only the selected creature instead of detecting in an area. You cast dispel magic at the same level as your champion focus spells. It must target an illusion the creature you hit created, a spell affecting the creature you hit, or an item the creature you hit wears or carries. The spell or item you attempt to counteract must be within 120 feet of you.
magicWeapons.paladin wielder: If you’re a champion of the paladin cause, you also gain the following two benefits.

magicWeapons.name: Frost Brand
magicWeapons.text: The blade of this +2 greater striking greater frost greatsword appears to be nothing but icy shards. The frost brand automatically extinguishes non-magical fires in a 20-foot emanation. While wielding it, you gain fire resistance 5. frost brand
magicWeapons.effect: You swing the frost brand into the area of an ongoing magical fire, and the blade attempts to counteract the fire with a counteract modifier of +27. If it fails, it can’t attempt to counteract the same fire again.

magicWeapons.name: Radiant Lance
magicWeapons.text: When wielded in battle, these silver lances blaze with light. A radiant lance is a +2 greater striking holy flaming silver lance . When wielded in battle, the radiant lance sheds bright light in a 60- foot radius. On a hit against an undead creature that is specifically vulnerable to sunlight, the lance bursts with a brilliant flash of light, and that undead must attempt a DC 35 Fortitude save. If the attack was a critical hit, the undead uses an outcome one degree of success worse than the result of its saving throw.
magicWeapons.failure: The undead is slowed 1 for 1 round.
magicWeapons.critical failure: The undead is slowed 1 for 1 minute.
magicWeapons.effect: You point the lance at a foe and call out, firing a beam with the effects of a 7th-level searing light .

magicWeapons.name: Luck Blade
magicWeapons.text: Luck and good fortune bless the wielder of this +3 greater striking shortsword . Luck blades are crafted in a variety of styles, but their hilts or blades always incorporate symbols of luck, such as clovers, horseshoes, fish, ladybugs, or other symbols. effect.

magicWeapons.text: Luck and good fortune bless the wielder of this +3 greater striking shortsword . Luck blades are crafted in a variety of styles, but their hilts or blades always incorporate symbols of luck, such as clovers, horseshoes, fish, ladybugs, or other symbols. effect. Some contain one when crafted. You can cast this spell as an arcane innate spell while wielding the , expending the spell. A spellcaster who can cast can place another into the blade by spending 8,000 gp and 4 days of downtime. A can hold no more than one at a time.

magicWeapons.name: Mattock of the Titans
magicWeapons.text: This 15-foot-long adamantine digging tool is far too big for even a Large creature to wield, though if you’re a Small or larger creature, you can wield it while wearing a , as though it were appropriately sized for you and had 2 Bulk. The GM might also allow you to wield the mattock if you have some other means of wielding oversized weapons, such as if you’re a Large barbarian with the giant instinct or are a Huge creature. When it’s used as a weapon, the mattock of the titans has the statistics of a +3 greater striking keen adamantine great pick . While you’re wielding the mattock of the titans , you gain a +3 item bonus to Athletics checks. You can use it to loosen or push soft earth at a rate of 1 minute per 5-foot cube or smash through solid stone at the rate of 5 minutes per 5-foot-cube.
magicWeapons.effect: You dig furiously with the mattock to non-magically replicate the effects of an earthquake spell.
magicWeapons.craft requirements: You are a titan, and the initial raw materials must include 8,100 gp of adamantine.

magicWeapons.text: The sturdy, steel head of this +3 major striking flaming shock orichalcum warhammer is shaped like a blazing comet. sky hammer fireball’s fireball
magicWeapons.trigger: Your attack roll with the sky hammer is a critical success;
magicWeapons.effect: A 6th-level arcane fireball spell explodes, centered on the sky hammer. The spell DC is 45. You are immune to the fireball’s effect, though your allies are not.
magicWeapons.craft requirements: Supply a casting of fireball (6th level), and the initial raw materials must include 12,375 gp of orichalcum.

critSpecialization.name: Axe
critSpecialization.text: Choose one creature adjacent to the initial target and within reach. If its AC is lower than your attack roll result for the critical hit, you deal damage to that creature equal to the result of the weapon damage die you rolled (including extra dice for its potency rune, if any). This amount isn’t doubled, and no bonuses or other additional dice apply to this damage.

critSpecialization.name: Bomb
critSpecialization.text: Increase the radius of the bomb’s splash damage (if any) to 10 feet.

critSpecialization.name: Bow
critSpecialization.text: If the target of the critical hit is adjacent to a surface, it gets stuck to that surface by the missile. The target is immobilized and must spend an Interact action to attempt a DC 10 Athletics check to pull the missile free; it can’t move from its space until it succeeds. The creature doesn’t become stuck if it is incorporeal, is liquid (like a water elemental or some oozes), or could otherwise escape without effort.

critSpecialization.name: Brawling
critSpecialization.text: The target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or be slowed 1 until the end of your next turn.

critSpecialization.name: Club
critSpecialization.text: You knock the target away from you up to 10 feet (you choose the distance). This is forced movement.

critSpecialization.name: Dart
critSpecialization.text: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

critSpecialization.name: Knife
critSpecialization.text: The target takes 1d6 persistent bleed damage. You gain an item bonus to this bleed damage equal to the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls.

critSpecialization.name: Pick
critSpecialization.text: The weapon viciously pierces the target, who takes 2 additional damage per weapon damage die.

critSpecialization.name: Polearm
critSpecialization.text: The target is moved 5 feet in a direction of your choice. This is forced movement.

critSpecialization.name: Shield
critSpecialization.text: You knock the target back from you 5 feet. This is forced movement.

critSpecialization.name: Sling
critSpecialization.text: The target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or be stunned 1.

critSpecialization.name: Spear
critSpecialization.text: The weapon pierces the target, weakening its attacks. The target is clumsy 1 until the start of your next turn.

critSpecialization.name: Sword
critSpecialization.text: The target is made off-balance by your attack, becoming flat-footed until the start of your next turn.
